description:
Let's kick things off by holding an event about the business of ... hosting events! Foxi.be is a Belgian events planning and promotions platform that aims at a niche clientèle of tradespeople and freelance entrepreneurs. Since their inception at the beginning of the year they've been helping people plan, host, and market events aimed at increasing business.

Foxi will be talking about some of the key insights they've gathered from events hosting at our first event, and will be available for more insightful questions about this growing startup.

Join us for drinks and networking afterwards!

Some relevant articles:
name: The 10 Event Organizing Mistakes

description: Mark Willems from Bubbles (@BubblesSOS) talks about some of the complications that have arisen during the introduction of his app, Bubbles, in the rather complicated cafe world in Belgium. Learn about what really goes on behind the counter at your favorite pub!
name: Order up! A new take on serving drinks

description: What does it take to make an app addictive? For that matter, when does anything become addictive?? Koen Dewit, owner at Zenjoy and psychologist by training, will come and explain what triggers human emotions and actions, and how to work some of these elements in to your own projects! It's good old fashioned psychology applied to modern business!
name: Hooked: building habit forming apps

description:
The verb "to fail" has a rather negative connotation, which makes sense as it implies that one hasn't succeeded at a goal. However, perhaps a more glass-half-full meaning could be that failing leads to an opportunity to interpret a situation in another way, possibly leading to better results on the next try. As a common occurrence in the business world it's up to the entrepreneur to decide which meaning he or she will follow.


Failing has often been stigmatised in Belgium, but is celebrated abroad. At this session we'll meet Alexander Vuylsteke, founder of Vools, and Niels Sellenslach of Crowdea. We'll learn about at which point they realised things weren't going right, what they did to remedy the situation then, and what they're doing now. We'll also see that failure doesn't mean it's the end of the line!
name: The Benefits of Failing

description:
As humans, we've been trading stuff for other stuff for ages. Then one day somebody invented money, and we started trading some more.

Going back to the roots of human nature, Eggs & Rabbit Holes (http://eggsandrabbitholes.com/) is bartering brought to the 21st century. The platform allows people to trade items with each other on an innovative new platform that takes people's interests into consideration and can actually make whole networks linking people to the items they want. Therefore, if you'd like to trade and item for something else, but the other person is interested in something else, the platform makes all the necessary connections, creating a loop of transactions, so that you can finally get that item. It makes a lot more sense when the EARH guys talk about it :-)

In short, online trading or a means of creating an on-the-spot currency system, EARH is a fascinating Belgian approach to a rather interesting problem!
name: Eggs & Rabbit Holes & Contemporary Trading

description:
Meet and learn from Uber Brussels on their novel (and about-damned-time) approach to taking the taxi in Brussels.

Find out how to go about managing the complexities of launching an already popular/infamous concept in the rigid and Brussels taxi scene.
name: Uber and a Traditional Belgian Industry

description:
Sick and tired of that stupid mini calculator you need to use to log on to online banking? Wondering why a piece of plastic is still a major means of payment? Don't worry, those days are coming to an end...

Sixdots (https://www.sixdots.be/), a very promising Belgian startup, is in the mobile payments business. They aim to completely replace your wallet by an app on your phone, and have been quite successful at getting major Belgian financial and telecom players to sign up for the platform. Come hear about how this Belgian high-tech company is changing the way many people are about to pay.

Doors open at 6pm, talk at 6.30pm.
name: Mobile Payments: it's finally happening in Belgium

description:
When a small business grows to include several players, a complex logistics and accounting system, many businesses opt for an ERP system. The problem, however, is that many ERP systems are rather generic and require significant (and expensive) custom work to be tailored to their needs.

Football clubs are no exception to the ERP story, which was all to familiar to Kevin Vermeulen. Come hear how Kevin took a passion for football, and a good knowledge of management, and transformed it to an all-encompassing business planning system for football teams: Pro Soccer Data (http://www.prosoccerdata.com/)

The company is now optimizing the internal structures of such notable teams as our very own Red Devils, RSC Anderlecht, and Cercle Brugge.


As always, talk starts at 6.30pm but doors open at 6. The talk is followed up by networking and a drink.
name: Football is a business. And businesses need tools.
